intro: Tradescantia papilionacea, commonly known as the "Maiden's blush" or "Flame violet," is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of 10–30 centimeters, featuring upright, branching stems covered in fine, hairy hairs. The plant produces small, showy flowers in shades of pink, red, and purple, arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a waxy, bluish-green appearance. Tradescantia papilionacea thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or swampy areas.
